sentence.text: Neurofibromatosis cardiac muscle tissue development 2 (NF2) is a tumor-forming disease of the nervous system caused by deletion or by loss-of-function mutations in NF2, encoding the tumor suppressing protein neurofibromin 2 (also known as schwannomin or negative regulation of cell proliferation).

The correlation of the tumor-suppressive function and conformation (open or closed) of neurofibromin 2 has been subject to much speculation, often based on extrapolation from other cellular response to oxidative stress proteins, and controversy.
